Plot.
In Schenectady, motorcycle stunt rider Lucas "Luke" Glanton drives in the 
globe of death of a travelling circus. On the day before he plans to leave 
town for a year, he is visited by a woman named Romina Gutierrez, who had a 
love affair with him. He finds that he has a baby with her, but Romina lives 
with another man, Kofi. Luke quits his job and decides to stay in the town. 
He befriends the owner of a small garage, Robin, who offers him a job and a 
place to stay. However, Luke does not make enough money to support his son 
and he decides to heist banks. One day, things go wrong and Luke is murdered 
by the rookie police officer Avery Cross. Avery is considered a hero by the 
press and soon he discovers corruption among his colleagues. The ambitious 
Avery plots a scheme seeking promotion and he gets evidence to put the 
police officers in prison. Fifteen years later, Avery is the Attorney 
General in Troy and he is estranged of his son AJ. Avery is in political 
campaign and sends AJ, who is a troublemaker, to Schenectady. Avery 
befriends his schoolmate Jason Kancam, who is Luke's son. Soon their 
lives are entwined and haunted by the past.
